title: no aspect is given in infer_example
body:
hello, this aspect sentiment analyzer project is really great!the infer_example file is a big help. but i do have a question which i can not find its answer! why the "aspect" of input is "null" ?
i changed the code a little bit so i can give the aspect manually to the evaluate method as below 
```
def evaluate(self, raw_texts , aspect ):
context_seqs = [self.tokenizer.text_to_sequence(raw_texts.lower().strip())]
aspect_seqs = [self.tokenizer.text_to_sequence(aspect.lower().strip())]

context_indices = torch.tensor(context_seqs, dtype=torch.int64).to(self.opt.device)   
aspect_indices = torch.tensor(aspect_seqs, dtype=torch.int64).to(self.opt.device)     
t_inputs = [context_indices, aspect_indices]                                          
t_outputs = self.model(t_inputs)                                                      
            
t_probs = F.softmax(t_outputs, dim=-1).cpu().numpy()                              
return t_probs 

```
but it looks like it has no effect on the output! for example i run:
```
 inf = Inferer(opt)                                                               
 t_probs = inf.evaluate(' the charger is great but design is awful', 'design')    
 print(t_probs.argmax(axis=-1) - 1)                                               
                                                              
```                    
the output is [1] but it should be -1 because the aspect that i want to know its polarity is negative!i tested this with many examples it looks the answer has nothing to do with the given aspect!
can you please explain what is the problem?
